bolometer/camera/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device)

bolometer/camera/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “Camera viewing the upper divertor”

bolometer/camera/channel.documentation: Set of channels (detector or pixel of a camera)

bolometer/camera/channel/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device)

bolometer/camera/channel/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/geomet.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x1_uni.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x2_uni.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x3_uni.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x1_wid.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/x2_wid.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/outlin.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour

bolometer/camera/channel/detector/surfac.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/geomet.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.
Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/x1_uni.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/x2_uni.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/x3_uni.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/x1_wid.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/x2_wid.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/outlin.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour

bolometer/camera/channel/aperture/surfac.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data

bolometer/camera/channel/etendue.documentation: Etendue (geometric extent) of the channel's optical system

bolometer/camera/channel/etendue_method.documentation: Method used to calculate the etendue. Index = 0 : exact calculation with a 4D integral; 1 : approximation with first order formula (detector surface times solid angle subtended by the apertures); 2 : other methods

bolometer/camera/channel/etendue_method/.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

bolometer/camera/channel/line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the reference line of sight of the channel, defined by two points when the beam is not reflected, a third point is added to define the reflected beam path

bolometer/camera/channel/line_of_sight/f.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

bolometer/camera/channel/line_of_sight/s.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

bolometer/camera/channel/line_of_sight/t.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

bolometer/camera/channel/validity_timed.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel as a function of time (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)

bolometer/camera/channel/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the channel for the whole acquisition period (0 means valid, negative values mean non-valid)

bolometer/power_radiated_total.documentation: Total radiated power reconstructed from bolometry data

bolometer/power_radiated_inside_lcfs.documentation: Radiated power from the plasma inside the Last Closed Flux Surface, reconstructed from bolometry data

bolometer/power_radiated_validity.documentation: Validity flag related to the radiated power reconstructions

bolometer/grid_type.documentation: Selection of one of a set of grid types for the 2D power density map

bolometer/grid_type/index.documentation: Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

bolometer/grid.documentation: Definition of the 2D grid (the content of dim1 and dim2 is defined by the selected grid_type)

bolometer/grid/volume_element.documentation: Volume of plasma enclosed in the cell formed by the nodes [dim1(i) dim2(j)], [dim1(i+1) dim2(j)], [dim1(i) dim2(j+1)] and [dim1(i+1) dim2(j+1)]

bolometer/power_density.documentation: Power density map in the poloidal cross-section, obtained from tomographic inversion of the bolometer data

bolometer/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network.
